words.defineEn: a clever and concise expression that contains a general truth or principle
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện thông minh và ngắn gọn có chứa một sự thật hoặc nguyên tắc chung

examples: In fact, all of us carry evolutionary anachronisms: goosebumps, our appendix, facial hair.
- It doesn't mean anything, it's just a really small anachronism.

So today, thanks to a certain amount of luck and resourcefulness, these anachronisms still patrol the skies, circling around, searching for food, and serving as messengers to us from a different time.
Its circulation was limited by an odd anachronism: these gazettes were still being written by hand.
There are lots of examples of anachronisms around today, and many of them date back to the Pleistocene.
words.defineEn: a thing placed in the wrong period of history
words.defineVi: một điều được đặt trong giai đoạn sai của lịch sử

examples: The museum showcased artifacts from different civilizations spanning over a hundred years.
And the stone artifacts were between 190,000 and 50,000 years old.
We got a weird artifact in our lens there.
But historical artifacts have been at the center of similar debates.
They had just kind of odd artifacts.
words.defineEn: a man-made object, tool, weapon, etc. that was created in the past and holds historical or cultural significance
words.defineVi: một đồ vật, công cụ, vũ khí, v.v. do con người tạo ra đã được tạo ra trong quá khứ và có ý nghĩa lịch sử hoặc văn hóa

examples: And so the president goes to Kenosha to buttress that.
So we have no disagreement about the need to buttress Social Security, get more revenue into the program.
Pointed arches, flying buttresses, and large windows made the structure more skeletal and ornate.
The flying buttresses, or the tunnels, help channel air around its teardrop shape and over the spoiler.
Until the opinion was buttressed by intelligency, it was very hard for us to talk about publicly.
words.defineEn: a protruding structure that supports a building or wall and is made out of bricks or stones
words.defineVi: một cấu trúc nhô ra hỗ trợ một tòa nhà hoặc bức tường và được làm bằng gạch hoặc đá

examples: As a dipping sauce connoisseur, I declared the cocktail sauce as the ideal accompaniment to my fried fish fillets.
- For the first test 54 wine connoisseurs were asked to compare a red and a white wine.
Besides presentation, cucumber connoisseurs also value thick, chewy bodies, and to a lesser extent, taste.

But some cigar connoisseurs now argue that cigars from countries like Nicaragua and Dominican Republic, which the industry calls New World cigars, have become both desirable and reliable in the market.
Nonetheless, despite an increasing appetite for cigars from other countries, some connoisseurs will insist that the most authentic smoke comes only from Cuban cigars.
words.defineEn: an individual who is an expert of art, food, music, etc. and can judge its quality
words.defineVi: một cá nhân là chuyên gia về nghệ thuật, ẩm thực, âm nhạc, v.v. và có thể đánh giá chất lượng của nó

examples: India presents a convenient counterpoint to Greece because knowledge-making in india was indeparable from a long religious tradition, sponsored by the state, and focused on applications.
Today we learned about libertarian free will and it’s counterpoint, hard determinism.
And a good counterpoint to that is what we've now observed in modern, developed nations.
Polling can actually serve as a counterpoint to this kind of bubble that's formed on social media that people think: "This is what everybody's talking about."
And I think that this is the sort of counterpoint, or an additional point after the idea that we talked about, with things being in or part of popular culture.
words.defineEn: a musical technique that consists of mixing two or more separate melodies into one harmony
words.defineVi: một kỹ thuật âm nhạc bao gồm trộn hai hoặc nhiều giai điệu riêng biệt thành một bản hòa âm

words.defineEn: the last section of a literary or dramatic piece where the plot is concluded and all the matters of the work is explained
words.defineVi: phần cuối cùng của một tác phẩm văn học hoặc kịch trong đó cốt truyện được kết thúc và tất cả các vấn đề của tác phẩm được giải thích

words.defineEn: a saying that coveys an idea in a manner that is short and witty
words.defineVi: một câu nói truyền tải một ý tưởng một cách ngắn gọn và hóm hỉnh

examples: - Eulogy for someone who died reading Yelp reviews.
You know, if I get hit by a bus tomorrow, there won't be anybody doing the eulogy going, "Well, he didn't drain every drop out of it."
words.defineEn: a text or speech dedicated to give high praise to a person or thing
words.defineVi: một văn bản hoặc bài phát biểu dành riêng để khen ngợi một người hoặc một vật

words.defineEn: the fact of having an excessive number of words that results in being tedious
words.defineVi: thực tế là có quá nhiều từ dẫn đến tẻ nhạt

examples: And he’s a great armchair raconteur.
words.defineEn: an individual who has the skill of telling stories in a way that is entertaining
words.defineVi: một cá nhân có kỹ năng kể chuyện theo cách giải trí

examples: The seasoned politician scoffed at the young upstart's superficial promises, muttering that you cannot catch old birds with chaff, as he knew from experience that voters were not easily swayed by empty rhetoric.
The debate between the two politicians was intense, as diamond cuts diamond, and both were skilled in rhetoric and argumentation.
AMNA NAWAZ: You mentioned the rhetoric.
A new American president used rhetoric that would resonate with Netanyahu's view of the world.
The gunman had been posting anti-Semitic rhetoric on Gab for years before the shooting.
words.defineEn: the study of the rules and different methods of using language in a way that is effective
words.defineVi: nghiên cứu các quy tắc và các phương pháp khác nhau để sử dụng ngôn ngữ theo cách hiệu quả

examples: The train announcement informed us about the next stop.
The receptionist informed me that the manager is not available at the moment.
Avoid showing him the beers, or he’ll inform your parents.
Mary kept her word and Henry was never informed.
Shortly after I was formally informed, the notice went out, the company buzzed with the news, and I trembled in my shoes.
words.defineEn: to characterize or influence a style, behavior, opinion, etc.
words.defineVi: để mô tả hoặc ảnh hưởng đến một phong cách, hành vi, ý kiến, vv

examples: Now this canonical idea egalitarianism is not the same thing as equality - at least the equality that we’ve come to think about in the present day.
In fact, Russian state television, Russian authorities, still haven’t to this day settled on one canonical, official version of events surrounding MH17.

So you’re talking about a mix of financially motivated groups, which include the canonical Macedonian teenagers but generally what you might consider light organized crime, groups of people who are creating the spammy content, doing ad fraud, who are working together to push that content on multiple platforms, and then a variety of clusters of activity that we didn’t think was financially motivated but we couldn’t trace back to a specific sponsor at the time.
words.defineEn: according to the rules that are broadly accepted or are official
words.defineVi: theo các quy tắc được chấp nhận rộng rãi hoặc là chính thức

examples: Some 20,000 people around the U.S. and 25 other countries apply each year by postcard, some quite fanciful, to have their names drawn for a coveted table.
One of the earliest written suggestions came from Geoffrey of Monmouth, a bishop famous for his fanciful writings on British history.
words.defineEn: coming from the imagination rather than facts
words.defineVi: đến từ trí tưởng tượng hơn là sự thật

examples: This is the figurative definition.
It's not a real paralysis, it's a figurative term.
Artists are thinking abstractly and figurative, trying to blur the lines between them.
They were the first figurative art made by both our kids somewhere between the ages of 2 and 3.
There are many extremely affecting memorials that are figurative, including German artist Käthe Kollwitz’s 1920 woodcut
words.defineEn: using language in a way that words don't have their actual meaning, but an imaginative meaning instead
words.defineVi: sử dụng ngôn ngữ theo cách mà các từ không có ý nghĩa thực sự của chúng, mà thay vào đó là một ý nghĩa tưởng tượng

examples: These different trials and tribulations but nothing felt hackneyed.
words.defineEn: (of phrases, words, ideas, etc.) used so much that it has lost its effect, interest, or originality
words.defineVi: (của cụm từ, từ ngữ, ý tưởng, v.v.) được sử dụng nhiều đến mức nó đã mất tác dụng, sự thú vị hoặc tính độc đáo

examples: Beyond the word's casual use, what makes something Kafkaesque?
It’s a Kafkaesque nightmare.
It's a Kafkaesque nightmare.
So on the one hand, it's easy to recognize the Kafkaesque in today's world.
They’re living a Kafkaesque nightmare.
words.defineEn: resembling Franz Kafka's works in being extremely nightmarish, bizarre, and confusing
words.defineVi: giống như các tác phẩm của Franz Kafka ở chỗ cực kỳ ác mộng, kỳ quái và khó hiểu

words.defineEn: (of language or music) clear and easy to understand
words.defineVi: (về ngôn ngữ hoặc âm nhạc) rõ ràng và dễ hiểu

examples: But Shelley’s original description is actually much more macabre.
Fairyflies have evolved a macabre solution to this: a parasitic lifestyle!
Sounds like fun, if a little macabre.
And while the worms are good at it, the next parasite on our list is a macabre master manipulator.
The original comes from a series of danse macabre images meant to show that death is universal.
words.defineEn: disturbing and fear inducing due to its connection with death, murder, violence, etc.
words.defineVi: làm phiền và sợ hãi gây ra do mối liên hệ của nó với cái chết, giết người, bạo lực, v.v.

words.defineEn: (of sounds) smooth, pleasant, and sweet to the ear
words.defineVi: (về âm thanh) êm tai, êm tai, ngọt ngào

examples: As so often happened, Peter, Tommy and Henry had totally lost sight of their real objective.
The company has outlined a strategic plan with specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound objectives.
It will cast light on the existing objective evidence, the gaps in knowledge and the scientific uncertainties.
One is being a very good, down-to-earth person who recognises that objectives are reached by working with others.
And the machine pursues the objective.
words.defineEn: existing externally and independent of one's feelings and thoughts
words.defineVi: tồn tại bên ngoài và độc lập với cảm xúc và suy nghĩ của một người

words.defineEn: seeming unreal, confusing, and dream-like
words.defineVi: dường như không có thật, khó hiểu và giống như mơ

examples: It's not that politicians carry two faces under one hood that is so surprising, but the fact that so many people accept such phony façades as the truth.
But this ensatina is a phony.
It's phony stuff.
Well, it struck me the caravan strategy, which was promulgated by Fox and other right-wing sources, was a phony from the start.
Here’s the thing that’s so phony about the media.
words.defineEn: not based on honesty or truth and is intended to mislead others
words.defineVi: không dựa trên sự trung thực hoặc sự thật và nhằm mục đích đánh lừa người khác

words.defineEn: referring to the happening of something in regard to one after one's demise
words.defineVi: đề cập đến việc xảy ra của một cái gì đó liên quan đến cái chết của một người

examples: The last delusion in this quadrad of delusions, is subjective doubles.
But questionnaires are still subjective.
It's so subjective.
- It's too subjective.
Because that's subjective.
words.defineEn: existing within one's mind and dependent on one's perspective rather than reality
words.defineVi: tồn tại trong tâm trí của một người và phụ thuộc vào quan điểm của một người hơn là thực tế
